title: What are the secrets of alchemy and why are they so obscure and difficult to understand?
first_phrase: In this text on alchemy, the author discusses the hidden meanings behind the language used by philosophers and alchemists. They caution against taking their words at face value, as they often use analogies and enigmas to convey their knowledge. The introduction for the last 200 tokens should clarify that the text will be citing examples of such statements by alchemists such as Braccesco, Schroeder, and Artefio. It will touch on the danger of taking these words literally and why it should cast doubt on those who dismiss alchemy as mere childishness.

last_phrase: In conclusion, it is clear that the world of alchemy is complex and full of esoteric knowledge that cannot be understood literally. As G. Braccesco cautioned, anyone who attempts to interpret alchemical texts in that way will find themselves lost. It is up to us to approach this subject with an open mind and willingness to explore its mysteries without dismissing it as mere childish chemistry.
